Primeiramente acho os gráficos visuais do jogo muito belos, jogando tanto no minimo quanto no máximo é um deslumbre visual incrível, a sua historia é algo que te segura para jogar o jogo, mesmo sendo um pouco mais curto do que gostaria é bem escrita, a mecânica do jogo é bem interessante misturando habilidades especias com poderes especiais que estão disponíveis a serem coletados e comprados durante todo o jogo. basicamente um experiencia divertida e que vale a pena.

This is an FPS, gameplay is going to get very bland. Weapon choices are limit and ammo is VERY limited. Gears (basically armor) are almost a non-factor in the game. Fights get frustrating because you are going to run out of ammo and have to beg your companion to magically summon ammo and toss you some because that is literally all that she does.

The story is great with twists and turns. However, there were parts in the game where you had choices to make and it felt as it never really matter what to you picked.

I would recommend this game for the atmosphere, color, and sound that this game has. It truly is a beautiful game along with the story of being in the shoes of Booker DeWitt.

A complete mindfuck game with steampunk vibes. How can you NOT love it?
Uno de los mejores juegos que jugué en mi vida, muy loco y entretenido

Let's get the things I disliked with the game out of the way shall we?

- It wasn't as atmospheric and involving when it came to world design as the original Bioshock.

-The story was brilliant but the ending didn't quite "click" with me even though it was really well written.
This doesn't mean it's bad though because it really isn't, I just didn't like it as much as the rest of the story.

-The music in combat was just . . .not good . . .and as someone who loves a good soundtrack this made me a bit sad.

Well, with that done let's get to what I loved with the game: the combat

Bioshock Infinite is just fun, it never really gets boring because it often gives you new powers to play around with and has enough weapons and enemies to keep things fresh throughout. The game also encourages you to use different weapons not always just handing you the ammunition you need but ammunition for guns you don't currently have equipped as well (you can only have 2 weapons equipped at a time).

The arenas where also really good with a lot of verticality and plenty resources scattered around. Enemies will run around a bit and use some parts of their surroundings like the skylines (big rails in (you guessed it) the sky that are used for transport) but other than that nothing special.

The enemy lineup was solid but nothing amazing, the only one that stood out was the handyman who basically countered every tactic I used which required me to actually use my brain and scared the sh*t out of me by doing so, but it was really fun.     

The weapons were varied and most of them were fun and made you play the game slightly differently, my favourites were the shotgun and sniper rifle. No weapon was really underpowered either so you choose based on what you like.

The vigors (superpowers?) were also varied and I found myself using the absolute majority of them in combat because they were very well balanced here as well and the different enviroments and enemy types made you switch between them quite often.

But the thing that makes the combat so good is the skyhook, using it to zip around the arenas on skylines just makes the combat so much better because it gets so much faster and allows for arenas to be bigger and more vertical. 
Some enemies will also follow you on the joyride which makes small stops to regain your shield or just chill out a bit really frantic.
This is the reason the combat kept me hooked (pun intended) throughout and it furthermore separates the game from the slew of military shooters on the market.

So check it out, you will (probably) enjoy it.

[h1]Bioshock Infinite[/h1] Un muy buen titulo que nos hará volar nuestra mente, un gran juego que toca de manera muy asertiva el concepto de múltiples universos paralelos, todo dentro de ese típico ambiente de suspenso y tétrico en el cual nunca sabes bien que y como encontraras más adelante. [spoiler]En esta ocasión y a diferencia de las primeras entregas de Bioshock, aquí seremos Booker DeWitt un detective que por culpa de una deuda de juego va en busca de una chica llamada Elizabeth dentro de una misteriosa ciudad voladora, racista, opresora y regida por un malvado Tirano que se hace llamar un profeta, Dewit y Elizabeth intentan escapar entre disparos, grandes retos y dilemas morales que ponen en gran suspenso esta obra de [i]Irrational Games[/i].[/spoiler]
Lo único que tal vez parezca malo es el echo de que en algunas ocasiones podrías sentir que algunas escenas son repetitivas pero si eres creativo a la hora de jugar puedes pasar por alto todo esos detalles fácil ya que la historia es muy entretenida e inteligente. Recomiendo altamente este juego, es uno de los shooters que más me han gustado del estilo cyberpunk pero ambientado durante una época cercana a la gran depresión estadounidense.
his voice is majestic

After playing the game completely and then diving a little harder into what the game was originally designed to be like, that is the aspirations of the developers, it's sad to see how so much was left out just so they could get the game out asap instead, that' not to say it's not a great looking game with great mechanics and a good story, it's just not what it could have been. big fan of the bioshock series, would recommend at standard or discounted price. 7/10
